meanings.definition: A document written entirely by the person whose signature it bears.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked for a holograph of the student's essay to verify its authenticity.
meanings.sent2: I found a holograph of my grandfather's will in the old family safe.
meanings.sent3: The detective chuckled as he examined the holograph, knowing it would reveal the true author.
meanings.sent4: Her handwritten letter was a holograph of her emotions, clear and unfiltered.
meanings.sent5: The holograph of the contract made it clear who had written the terms.

meanings.definition: A three-dimensional image formed by the interference of light beams from a laser or other coherent light source.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a holograph of a dinosaur that seemed to come to life.
meanings.sent2: I was amazed by the holograph of a butterfly that fluttered in the air before disappearing.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they reached out to touch the holograph, expecting it to feel solid.
meanings.sent4: The holograph of the city skyline projected a futuristic vision of urban life.
meanings.sent5: The holograph of the singer on stage was so realistic, I almost thought she was there in person.
